pages.page:
Sed Vitae: UNC Alumni Inspiring Stories
UNC 75th Foundation Anniversary
Celebrating with Gratefulness and Hope UNC General Alumni Association Inc. Compiled by Gloria O. Labuanan
Souvenir Program
University of Nueva Caceres Press
Naga City, 2021

MESSAGES
Congratulations to the University of Nueva Caceres, Naga City, for celebrating its 75th Foundation Day!
It is seldom that an institution reaches its diamond anniversary let alone its 75th year! Only a University with outstanding faculty / officials that can attract a superb studentry deserves the accolade that it now reaps!
Again, my heartfelt congratulations!
MR. FELICITO C. PAYUMO
Vice Chairman of the Board of Trustees University of Nueva Caceres

MESSAGES
75 years ago, there was growing demand in Bicol for a high-quality educational institution that would be affordable to students from all walks of life. UNC was founded with the unique promise to meet this need for Bicolanos. Up to this day, UNC has remained faithful to that commitment, and has even surpassed its initial objectives and is now one of the pillars of economic and social growth for Naga and the greater Bicol region.
Through my involvement with Ayala’s acquisition of UNC in 2015, my trips to Naga became opportunities for discovery and wonder. I was impressed by the legacy of the Hernandez family in founding a school that would serve Naga and its environs. The school’s motto -- “Non Scholæ Sed Vitæ” , or “We do not learn for school but for life” – captured the soul and spirit of UNC that I got to know as I encountered more of the people, and their caring and nurturing culture that defines the institution.
Let me extend my praise in particular to President Fay Lauraya and her team, who are gems in their own right. They have tirelessly carried on the founders’ legacy, while adapting to the demands of the modern age. Under their leadership, UNC has become known for excellence in academics, a deep engagement in community building, and concrete improvements in the lives of UNC graduates and their families.
Diamonds are known for their beauty formed through conditions of extreme temperature and pressure. Likewise, though UNC has faced many adversities over the past 75 years, including a world war and an unprecedented global pandemic, it continues to shine with brilliance and clarity of purpose.
Keep shining, UNC! Happy diamond anniversary!
MS. BERNADETTE NEPOMUCENO Member, Board of Trustees University of Nueva Caceres

MESSAGES
The Ayala Group of Companies joins the University of Nueva Caceres community in celebrating its 75th founding anniversary. May this day mark the beginning of more meaningful years for UNC.
As strong believers of the education sector’s ability to shape our nation, we at Ayala are honored to be a partner of this great institution. In 2015, Ayala was given an opportunity to help UNC become the nurturing, future-ready institution that it is today. We knew then that we were not just investing in a strong educational institution, but we were also helping build the future of our nation.
As the oldest and the first university in southern Luzon, UNC has uplifted the quality of education not just in Naga City but across the Bicol region and beyond. UNC has helped shaped some of the country’s most brilliant professionals and public servants who have made significant contributions in their chosen fields. In the years to come, we believe that you will continue to hone talents who share our vigor to serve the nation.
Together with the Yuchengco Group of Companies, the Ayala community wishes you a “great, grand, glorious” Diamond Jubilee Celebration.
ATTY. SOLOMON HERMOSURA
Member, Board of Trustees University of Nueva Caceres

MESSAGES
Congratulations, University of Nueva Caceres (UNC), for reaching this milestone with great 75 years of service transforming lives of the Bicolanos! It is a great honor and privilege to be part of UNC and to witness what you have achieved over the past years reaching its goal of providing quality education to and preparing the future of UNC students!
Today, we celebrate not only UNC’s Diamond Jubilee, but also the relentless dedication and utmost commitment of every member of UNC family – faculty and staff, teaching and non- teaching – most especially, Dr. Fay Lea Patria M. Lauraya, for the great lead you have provided this long-time esteemed institution. You continue to take the company to a whole new level of success! Congratulations to you and all UNC family members! Indeed, this is not just a celebration of anniversary but a recollection and recognition of Almighty God’s untiring hands and provision of protection, wisdom, and guidance to everyone’s efforts and achievements that has challenged all odds, especially the recent years, just so to continue to grow strong and achieve greater things together. I know, going through the pandemic has not been an easy journey, but it has been fulfilling! Let’s look forward to the best in the coming years, all by God’s grace and for His glory!
I congratulate all of you on another successful year! Continue to crystalize the faith, the foresight and the future of every Bicolano. Wishing UNC many more years of unparalleled success!
MS. SHIRLEY Q. EARNHART
Member, Board of Trustees University of Nueva Caceres

MESSAGES
Congratulations to UNC on this momentous occasion!
It is indeed admirable that for the past 75 years, UNC has continuously provided good, quality education for Bicolanos – truly making it one of the most valuable institutions in the province, and thereby contributing to nation building.
Best wishes to UNC and may it continue to uplift and enrich the lives of Bicolanos in the province and even beyond!
ATTY. SAM TORRES
Member, Board of Trustees University of Nueva Caceres

Commissioner

MESSAGES
Standing strong for the last seventy-five (75) years as an educational institution denotes two things: the ability of the institution to withstand challenges and constraints, and its commitment to provide comparable education.
Congratulations University of Nueva Caceres as you celebrate your 75th Founding Anniversary. No doubt, UNC has sustained its operations and raised the bar of its services for the past seven and a half decades, as proven by its accredited programs, performance in licensure exams, state-of-the-art facilities, competitive staff and students, and awards received.
You are truly blessed because despite the pandemic and all that you have been through, you continue to be a “blessing” to the Bicolanos, as you “harvest” well-rounded professionals, most of whom are now occupying notable positions in the public and private sector.
While we live in a VUCA (Volatile, Uncertain, Complex and Ambiguous) world, I believe that the University of Nueva Caceres will remain strong, steadfast and future-ready. On behalf of the Commission on Higher Education Regional Office V, I express my warm felicitations to the University for being resilient and progressive! Have a joyous Diamond Jubilee Anniversary, UNC!
ATTY. SEPTON A. DE LA CRUZ, CESO III
Regional Director
